title: Ship Lines
summary: A line of ships is a group of starships that share physical and statistical characteristics. They are often obtained in similar ways.
full_text:
A line of ships is a group of starships that share physical and statistical characteristics. They are often obtained in similar ways. 

Fast, light, shield-based combat ships.

Shield-based fighters, hull-based tank warships.

Ultrafast, ultralight combat ships.

Fast, light combat ships with high regeneration.

Slow, high-firepower, tanky hull-based combat ships.

High-firepower hull-based combat ships from the Foralkan Empire.

High-energy, highly customizable hull-based combat ships from the Kavani Mandate.

Balanced shield-based combat ships from the Lycentian Federation.

Slow, strong small miners.

Fast, weak small miners.

Powerful warship miners.

Mining Guild miner-haulers, sacrificing mining power for cargo space.

Cheap, neutral haulers.

Massive Trade Union haulers.

Fast, stealthy Syndicate haulers.

Vendor ships that allow selling items to other players.

Although Dreadnoughts do not exist in-game, lines are named based on the Dreadnought of the line. For example, the dreadnought of the Constellation line is called the Constellation. When the name of the dreadnought is not known, the name of a different ship is used, like for the Marlin Line.
Other Possible Ship Lines

sections.title: Trivia
sections.content:
Although Dreadnoughts do not exist in-game, lines are named based on the Dreadnought of the line. For example, the dreadnought of the Constellation line is called the Constellation. When the name of the dreadnought is not known, the name of a different ship is used, like for the Marlin Line.
